ezvcard.io.chain

Class ChainingTextParser<T extends ChainingTextParser<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ezvcard.io.chain.ChainingTextParser<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChainingTextStringParser

    public class ChainingTextParser<T extends ChainingTextParser<?>>
extends Object
    Chainer class for parsing traditional, plain-text vCards.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt
    See Also:
    Ezvcard.parse(InputStream), Ezvcard.parse(File), Ezvcard.parse(Reader)

    • Method Detail

      • caretDecoding

        public T caretDecoding(boolean enable)
        Sets whether the reader will decode characters in parameter values that use circumflex accent encoding (enabled by default).
        Parameters:
        enable - true to use circumflex accent decoding, false not to
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        VCardReader.setCaretDecodingEnabled(boolean), RFC 6868

      • register

        public T register(VCardPropertyScribe<? extends VCardProperty> scribe)
        Registers a property scribe.
        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe
        Returns:
        this

      • warnings

        public T warnings(List<List<ParseWarning>> warnings)
        Provides a list object that any parser warnings will be put into.
        Parameters:
        warnings - the list object that will be populated with the warnings of each parsed vCard. Each element in the list is a list of warnings for one parsed vCard. Therefore, the size of this list will be equal to the number of parsed vCards. If a vCard does not have any warnings, then its warning list will be empty.
        Returns:
        this

      • first

        public VCard first()
            throws IOException
        Reads the first vCard from the stream.
        Returns:
        the vCard or null if there are no vCards
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an I/O problem

      • all

        public List<VCard> all()
                throws IOException
        Reads all vCards from the stream.
        Returns:
        the parsed vCards
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an I/O problem
